q: Kaziranga National Park is located in which state?
desc: Kaziranga National Park is located in Assam.

q: Which animal is Kaziranga National Park especially known for?
desc: Kaziranga is famous for the one-horned rhinoceros.

q: Sonai Rupai Wildlife Sanctuary is in which state?
desc: Sonai Rupai Wildlife Sanctuary is located in Assam.

q: Namdapha National Park is located in which state?
desc: Namdapha National Park is in Arunachal Pradesh.

q: Which of the following is found in Namdapha National Park?
desc: Namdapha is home to the king cobra, along with elephants and tigers.

q: Gautam Buddha Sanctuary is located in which state?
desc: Gautam Buddha Sanctuary is located in Bihar.

q: Which animal is not found in Gautam Buddha Sanctuary?
desc: Gautam Buddha Sanctuary houses barking deer, not black buck.

q: Achanakmar Sanctuary is located in which Indian state?
desc: Achanakmar Sanctuary is located in Chhattisgarh.

q: Velvadore National Park is famous for which animals?
desc: Velvadore National Park is a reserve for wolf and black buck.

q: Where is the Wild Ass Sanctuary located?
desc: The Wild Ass Sanctuary is located in Gujarat.

q: Which of these animals is found in Wild Ass Sanctuary?
desc: Wild Ass Sanctuary houses chinkara among other species.

q: Gir Forest is famous for which wild animal?
desc: Gir Forest is Indiaâ€™s largest wildlife sanctuary famous for the Gir lions.

q: Dachigam National Park is in which region?
desc: Dachigam National Park is located in Jammu and Kashmir.

q: Which of the following is found in Dachigam National Park?
desc: Dachigam National Park is home to the Kashmiri stag (Hangul).

q: Where is Bannerghatta National Park located?
desc: Bannerghatta National Park is located in Karnataka.

q: Which of the following birds are found in Bannerghatta National Park?
desc: Bannerghatta National Park is home to grey partridge and green pigeon.

q: Bhadra Sanctuary is located in which state?
desc: Bhadra Sanctuary is located in Karnataka.

q: Which of the following animals is NOT mentioned as found in Bhadra Sanctuary?
desc: Lions are not found in Bhadra Sanctuary.

q: Bandipur National Park and Dandeli Sanctuary are located in which states?
desc: Bandipur National Park and Dandeli Sanctuary are located in Karnataka and Tamil Nadu.

q: Which combination of animals is common in Bandipur and Dandeli Sanctuary?
desc: Elephant and tiger are both found in Bandipur and Dandeli Sanctuary.

q: Tungabhadra Sanctuary is located in which Indian state?
desc: Tungabhadra Sanctuary is in Karnataka.

q: Which combination of animals is found in Tungabhadra Sanctuary?
pool: Panther, elephant, king cobra, and wolf
Tiger, panther, elephant, cheetal, sambhar, and wild boar
Elephant, leopard, black buck, and deer
answer: Tiger, panther, elephant, cheetal, sambhar, and wild boar
desc: Tungabhadra Sanctuary hosts all these species.

q: Which park is famous for the Indian Muntjac (barking deer)?
desc: The barking deer (Indian Muntjac) is found in Gautam Buddha Sanctuary.

q: Where is the Wild Ass Sanctuary located?
desc: Wild Ass Sanctuary is in Gujarat.

q: Gir Forest is located in which state?
desc: Gir Forest is located in Gujarat.

q: Nagarhole National Park is located in which state?
desc: Nagarhole National Park is located in Karnataka.

q: Which of the following animals is found in Nagarhole National Park?
desc: Nagarhole houses four-horned antelope along with panther and cheetal.

q: Pachmarhi Sanctuary is located in which state?
desc: Pachmarhi Sanctuary is in Madhya Pradesh.

q: Which primate is found in Pachmarhi Sanctuary?
desc: Rhesus macaques are found in Pachmarhi Sanctuary.

q: Where is Gandhi Sagar Sanctuary located?
desc: Gandhi Sagar Sanctuary is in Madhya Pradesh.

q: Bandhavgarh National Park is located in which state?
desc: Bandhavgarh National Park is in Madhya Pradesh.

q: Which bird species are found in Bandhavgarh National Park?
desc: Bandhavgarh is home to wild birds along with cheetal and sambhar.

q: Simlipal Sanctuary is located in which state?
desc: Simlipal Sanctuary is located in Odisha.

q: Which animal is NOT listed as part of Simlipal Sanctuary?
desc: Cheetah is not listed among the fauna of Simlipal Sanctuary.

q: Which sanctuary is known for water birds?
desc: Ghana Bird Sanctuary in Rajasthan is famous for water birds.

q: Where is Ghana Bird Sanctuary located?
desc: Ghana Bird Sanctuary is located in Rajasthan.

q: Khangchendzonga National Park is in which Indian state?
desc: Khangchendzonga National Park is located in Sikkim.

q: Which rare animal is found in Khangchendzonga National Park?
desc: Snow leopard is found in Khangchendzonga National Park.

q: Vedanthangal Bird Sanctuary is in which state?
desc: Vedanthangal Bird Sanctuary is located in Tamil Nadu.

q: What is Vedanthangal Bird Sanctuary famous for?
desc: Vedanthangal Bird Sanctuary is an important bird sanctuary.

q: Chandraprabha Sanctuary is located in which state?
desc: Chandraprabha Sanctuary is located in Uttar Pradesh.

q: Which lions were once introduced in Chandraprabha Sanctuary?
desc: Gir lions were once introduced in Chandraprabha Sanctuary.

q: Which sanctuary is located near the India-Nepal border in Uttar Pradesh?
desc: Dudhwa National Park is located in Uttar Pradesh near the India-Nepal border.

q: Corbett National Park is located in which state?
desc: Corbett National Park is in Uttarakhand.

q: Who is Corbett National Park named after?
desc: Corbett National Park is named in memory of Jim Corbett.

q: Jaldapara Sanctuary is in which state?
desc: Jaldapara Sanctuary is located in West Bengal.

q: Which of the following animals are found in Jaldapara Sanctuary?
desc: Jaldapara Sanctuary is known for rhinoceros and elephants.

q: Sunderban Tiger Reserve is located in which Indian state?
desc: Sunderban Tiger Reserve is located in West Bengal.

q: Which aquatic mammal is found in Sunderban Tiger Reserve?
desc: Sunderban Tiger Reserve is home to the Gangetic dolphin.

q: Which of the following sanctuaries is dedicated mainly to birds?
desc: Ghana Bird Sanctuary is a dedicated bird sanctuary.

q: Which biosphere reserve is located in both Madhya Pradesh and Chhattisgarh?
desc: Achanakamar-Amarkantak (UNESCO) lies in Madhya Pradesh and Chhattisgarh.

q: Which biosphere reserve is located in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands?
desc: Great Nicobar is a UNESCO Biosphere Reserve in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands.

q: What is the type of Cold Desert Biosphere Reserve?
desc: Cold Desert Biosphere Reserve in Himachal Pradesh is classified under Western Himalayas.

q: Which Biosphere Reserve in Uttarakhand is classified under the Western Himalayas?
desc: Nanda Devi (UNESCO) in Uttarakhand is in the Western Himalayas.

q: Which biosphere reserve covers the largest area?
desc: The Great Rann of Kachchh covers an area of 12,454 kmÂ² â€” the largest in the list.

q: What is the area of Nilgiri Biosphere Reserve?
desc: Nilgiri (UNESCO) Biosphere Reserve spans 5520 kmÂ² across TN, Kerala & Karnataka.

q: In which type is the Agasthyamalai Biosphere Reserve categorized?
desc: Agasthyamalai Biosphere Reserve lies in the Western Ghats.

q: Which biosphere reserve is located in Andhra Pradesh?
desc: Seshachalam Hills Biosphere Reserve is in Andhra Pradesh.

q: Which biosphere reserve in West Bengal is part of the Gangetic Delta?
desc: Sundarbans (UNESCO) is part of the Gangetic Delta in West Bengal.

q: Which biosphere reserve is shared by Kerala, Tamil Nadu, and Karnataka?
desc: Nilgiri Biosphere Reserve spans across Tamil Nadu, Kerala, and Karnataka.

q: The Gulf of Mannar Biosphere Reserve is located in which state?
desc: The Gulf of Mannar Biosphere Reserve is located in Tamil Nadu.

q: Which biosphere reserve is located in Sikkim?
desc: Khangchendzonga (UNESCO) is a Biosphere Reserve in Sikkim.

q: Which biosphere reserve in Odisha is part of the Deccan Peninsula?
desc: Simlipal (UNESCO) in Odisha falls under the Deccan Peninsula type.

q: Which reserve is found in the Maikala Range?
desc: Achanakamar-Amarkantak is part of the Maikala Range.

q: Which state contains the Nokrek Biosphere Reserve?
desc: Nokrek (UNESCO) is located in Meghalaya.

q: Which biosphere reserve lies in the Desert region?
desc: Great Rann of Kachchh in Gujarat is classified as Desert type.

q: Which is the only biosphere reserve with an area under 1000 kmÂ²?
desc: Nokrek Biosphere Reserve in Meghalaya is the smallest listed, at 820 kmÂ².

q: Which of the following biosphere reserves is NOT under UNESCO?
desc: Seshachalam Hills is not marked as a UNESCO biosphere reserve in the table.

q: Which biosphere reserve is in Assam and part of the East Himalayas?
desc: Manas Biosphere Reserve in Assam lies in the East Himalayas.

q: Which biosphere reserve covers 10500 kmÂ² and lies on the coast?
desc: Gulf of Mannar (UNESCO) is a coastal reserve spanning 10,500 kmÂ².

q: Which biosphere reserve has an area closest to 3000 kmÂ²?
desc: Panna (UNESCO) in Madhya Pradesh covers 2998 kmÂ².

q: Which reserve in Arunachal Pradesh is part of the East Himalayas?
desc: Dihang-Dibang in Arunachal Pradesh is part of the East Himalayas.

q: Which biosphere reserve spans Kerala and Tamil Nadu?
desc: Agasthyamalai (UNESCO) spans Kerala and Tamil Nadu.

q: Which reserve in Madhya Pradesh is classified as semi-arid?
desc: Pachmarhi (UNESCO) in Madhya Pradesh lies in the semi-arid zone.

q: Which was the first wildlife conservation project started in India?
desc: Project Hangul was launched in 1970 to protect the Hangul or Kashmir Stag.

q: In which year was Project Tiger launched?
desc: Project Tiger was initiated in 1973 to ensure the survival of the tiger population in India.

q: Which project was launched in 1972?
desc: Project Gir was launched in 1972 to conserve the Asiatic Lion in the Gir Forest.

q: Which turtle species was targeted by a 1975 conservation project?
desc: Project Olive Ridley Turtles was started in 1975 to protect this vulnerable marine species.

q: Which project was launched to conserve the Manipur Thamin?
desc: Launched in 1977, this project aimed to protect the brow-antlered deer native to Manipur.

q: Which year saw the beginning of the Crocodile Breeding Scheme?
desc: The Crocodile Breeding Scheme was initiated in 1975 to protect declining crocodile populations.

q: Which animal is the focus of the 1987 Project Rhino?
desc: Project Rhino, started in 1987, aims to conserve the endangered one-horned rhinoceros.

q: What is the main objective of Project Elephant launched in 1992?
desc: Project Elephant was launched in 1992 to conserve elephants and their habitats.

q: In which year was Project Red Panda launched?
desc: Project Red Panda began in 1996 to protect this endangered mammal found in Eastern Himalayas.

q: Which project was launched to conserve sea turtles?
desc: Project Sea Turtle was launched in 1999 to conserve different species of sea turtles.

q: Project Vulture was initiated in which year?
desc: Project Vulture was launched in 2006 to conserve critically endangered vulture species in India.

q: Which conservation project began in 2009?
desc: Project Snow Leopard was started in 2009 to protect snow leopards in the high Himalayas.

q: Which two animal projects were started in 2020?
desc: Project Dolphin and Project Asiatic Lion were both initiated in 2020.

q: Which of these birds is endangered in India?
desc: The Great Indian Bustard is critically endangered and is a priority for conservation efforts.

q: Which of these mammals is endangered in India?
desc: Flying Squirrel is listed as an endangered mammal in India.

q: Which endangered reptile is known for living in rivers?
desc: The Gharial is a river-dwelling crocodilian species that is critically endangered in India.

q: Which species is an endangered amphibian in India?
desc: The Tiger Toad is an endangered amphibian found in India.

q: Which bird listed as endangered has a name related to forests?
desc: The Forest Owlet is a critically endangered bird species found in India.

q: Which mammal from the endangered list is known for its horn?
desc: The One-Horned Rhinoceros is critically endangered and found in the grasslands of Assam.

q: Which is a critically endangered sea turtle in India?
desc: Hawksbill Turtles are critically endangered due to habitat loss and poaching.

q: Which endangered mammal is native to the eastern Himalayas?
desc: Red Panda is found in the Eastern Himalayas and is endangered due to habitat loss.

q: Which species from the endangered list is a bird found in high altitudes?
desc: Himalayan Quail is a rare and possibly extinct bird, once found in Uttarakhand.

q: Which amphibian on the list is capable of gliding or leaping?
desc: Flying Frogs can leap long distances and are considered endangered.

q: Which endangered mammal is found in the Gir Forest?
desc: The Asiatic Lion is only found in the Gir Forest of Gujarat and is critically endangered.

q: Which endangered reptile has 'gecko' in its name?
desc: Sispara Day Gecko is an endangered lizard species found in the Western Ghats.
